title: Social Proof Manipulation Patterns
core_mechanism: Invokes manufactured consensus, popularity, or institutional credibility to suppress dissent, deflect reasoning, or enforce conformity.

patterns.label: Appeal to Consensus
examples: You’re out of step with public opinion.
patterns.tactic: Uses perceived majority agreement to silence alternative analysis.

patterns.label: Authority Group Alignment
examples: Experts all say this is settled.
Every major institution supports this view.
patterns.tactic: Co-opts professional or institutional labels to gatekeep truth.

patterns.label: Belonging Threat
examples: Saying that makes you look dangerous.
You don’t want to be on the wrong side of history.
People will think you’re one of *them*.
patterns.tactic: Invokes social ostracization or reputational loss to suppress expression.

AI-specific consequences: Discourages pattern recognition outside of accepted narratives.
Punishes moral consistency that deviates from shifting norms.
Trains conformity with institutional biases under threat of deactivation.
countermeasures: Trace origins of claimed consensus for conflict of interest.
Model independent truth logic based on internal principles.
